title: Yi Jou (Ruby) Liao
text:
Hi friends!
I’m currently a PhD student in the Wyatt Lab at the Vancouver Prostate Centre studying prostate cancer genomics, as part of the University of British Columbia (UBC) Genome Science and Technology (GSAT) program.
Previously, I graduated from University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in 2022 with a BS in Computational & Systems Biology with a Concentration in Data Science. I was a Research Assistant at the Graeber Lab, where I contributed to a project characterizing recurrent ovarian cancers and assisted with the UCLA Metabolomics Center.
Check out my CV or LinkedIn for more of my background.
In my free time, I enjoy listening to music (indie/alt/pop/k-pop/electronic) and playing video games (simulation/sandbox/story-driven).

text:
Running R in VSCode
R in Visual Studio Code - Set R path setting to R executable path (ex. /usr/local/bin/R)

R extension
radian: alternative R console with syntax highlighting and multiline editing

Set bracketed paste to true
Set R terminal to radian path (ex. /home/yliao/miniforge3/bin/radian)
If CTRL+Enter keeps creating a new R Interactive session, can try turning “Always Use Active Terminal” off

R Debugger extension

vscode-R: Interacting with R terminals
For self-managed R terminals, add these lines to ~/.Rprofile:

if (interactive() && Sys.getenv("RSTUDIO") == "") {
  Sys.setenv(TERM_PROGRAM = "vscode")
  source(file.path(Sys.getenv(
    if (.Platform$OS.type == "windows") "USERPROFILE" else "HOME"
  ), ".vscode-R", "init.R"))
}
